attributes.action: Reclassify the antihistamine fexofenadine hydrochloride from POM to P.
attributes.background: There should be greater availability of more powerful antihistamines which can help to reverse the allergic reaction process in the very early stages. Fexofenadine hydrochloride is available at pharmacies in many European countries, UAE, Japan and Australia.
attributes.additional_details:
According to Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency (May, 2016) as part of a freedom of information request, the drug remains as classified as a prescription only medicine (POM) in the UK.
Many deaths could be prevented as a result of reclassification to P, where the drug can be made more accessible by being issued under the supervision of a pharmacist.

attributes.action: School should start at 10am as teenagers are too tired
attributes.background: Teenagers are so tired due to having to wake up very early to get to school. The Government should require secondary schools to start later, which will lead to increased productivity at school.

attributes.action: Human trafficking Sex slavery: anyone found guilty receives a life sentence
attributes.background: Sex slavery one of the many forms of slavery, under the banner Human Trafficking. An estimated 4.8 million (mainly) women and children are sex slaves worldwide. They are stolen, locked up, beaten, can't leave the home , forced out as prostitutes and raped by up to 200 men a day.
attributes.additional_details: The lives of these innocent people are stolen, and if they survive they are damaged for life. The same as murder. I've read cases where the abuser has had lots of women locked up and raped all day long , even children. When he is found guilty he might only get 2 years in jail while these innocent people are destroyed. If this evil becomes a guaranteed life sentence it will decrease the numbers of victims. Any other punishment for such evil is too low. Please see: Hope for Justice, and Love for Justice international.

attributes.action: Repeal Welfare Reform Act 2012 and ban outright zero hours contracts
attributes.background: The Welfare Reform Act 2012 and zero hours contracts are causing huge levels of social deprivation and poverty impacting significantly on disabled and vulnerable people which must be stopped.

attributes.action: Allow Tattoos for 16 year olds with parental consent
attributes.background: Allow special tattoos for 16 year olds in meanings of birth, death and engagements e.g. 16.04.10 and scan photo or 16.04.10 to 28.02.64 and picture portrait.
attributes.additional_details: Allow memorable tattoos for 16 year olds.

attributes.action: Introduce official national ID cards or make PASS cards part of the law
attributes.background: Many people lose their IDs such as driving license which is difficult and costly to replace.PASS hologram cards supposedly should fix this problem but until this day not every place recognises this type of identification.We need the government to introduce something that would be recognisable fully
attributes.additional_details: PASS hologram cards donâ€™t work everywhere from my experience as many places like nightclubs are not even aware of them and usually they reject people that have them. What is the point for the government to support a scheme that is not effective. We need a government issued national ID or make PASS hologram cards part of official identification here in England in order to solve this problem as carrying driving licences or passports is a big risk to take and a long process to replace

attributes.action: Invite Polish Armed Forces to take a part in all future Remembrance Day Parades
attributes.background: During the war, more than 200,000 members of the Polish Armed Forces in the West had fought under British High Command. The British government did not specifically invite representatives of the Polish forces that had fought under British High Command for the London Victory Celebrations of 1946
attributes.additional_details: There is no significant effort being put in acknowledging and recognition, all the effort, sacrifice of service men and women who fought in WWII under B.H.C. These people are almost gone and are still feeling betrayed and forgotten, unappreciated. It's one of the last chances for the British Government to change the mistake of the historical decisions and make it good for the future and for the post Brexit relations between Poles living in the UK and Britons.

attributes.action: Make selling a new house without building regulation sign-off illegal.
attributes.background: New build houses are being sold without a buildings regulation approval certificate being handed over on completion. Make selling a new build house that has not been signed off by building control illegal and a prosecutable offence.

attributes.action: Make repeat offenders pay a percentage for emergency service costs
attributes.background:
Persons who are being repeatdly arrested for offending for: affray, public disturbance, ABH or GBH should pay a percentage of the emergency service costs which attended the scene.
Court costs recover some expenses but not all. A levy should be applied in these cases.
attributes.additional_details:
This method would help as a deterrent to knife attacks/gang crime, and it would also make it fair for persons who do not cause undue expenses from the emergency services.
Crime is on the rise and there are more gangs than ever.
This levy could also be expanded to moped theft gangs for the expense of a vehicle/foot pursuit.
Some persons cannot afford fines, but in that case then this would also help a legal case to get the dangerous repeat offenders locked up.

attributes.action: Tax Break for citizens who are renting and do not own a home
attributes.background: Government should give tax-breaks to those who are renting. Foreign investment in housing has allowed companies to make housing their business by buying/selling & renting out. This causes house prices and rents to continuously soar and has already made homes unaffordable to middle-class citizens.
attributes.additional_details: Whenever new flats are built some percentage of it goes to council. Then a huge percentage are bought by foreign/local companies. Then whatever flats are left, some of them are bought by people who already have homes. This puts a huge pressure on supply and greatly increases the supply-demand gap that triggers house prices shoot up. Home is a basic necessity as food & water, and therefore it cannot be allowed to become a business. If Government is not doing enough, then people should be compensated.

attributes.action: Increase nhs staff awareness and training on the signs and symptoms of sepsis
attributes.background:
I have since heard of many other cases of children with sepsis being misdiagnosed having gastroenteritis, sometimes with long term effects. 
I want government to look at this issue and increase training awareness within the nhs to prevent more unnecessary child deaths or life changing effects.
attributes.additional_details:
Our son, had severe leg pain, a very high temperature, vomiting and neck stiffness. We called 111 who sent us an ambulance to a and e. When we arrived, were seen by the doctor, he took a brief look over our son and asked of his symptoms. We said the symptoms, then he concluded that it could be gastroenteritis. He said we could take him home if he could keep some food down, which he did. However I said I was very concerned as he could not sit up unaided at this point and I would like another opinion. The paedeatrician came and immediately suggested meningitis and sepsis. He took bloods immediately and put our son onto strong antibiotics (this saved his life). The bloods later came back as positive for meningococcal septaceamia. 
Without fast treatment for Sepsis, it can be fatal.

attributes.action: Stop under 18s using social media and dating sites until age verified
attributes.background: Stop all under 18s using social media and dating sites until age verified at 18 same as gambling sites to eliminate child grooming and paedophile activity
attributes.additional_details: Girls are adding random guys all over the world and sending illicit photos of themselves and sexting my daughter was 1 of these at the age of 16 I have now took all media off her including her phone but I would like it stopped nationally as it's unsafe for any child

attributes.action: Redefine the term â€˜majorityâ€™ in regards to referendums as a minimum of 65%.
attributes.background: 52% is NOT  majority; this means that the will of a significant portion of the population goes unheeded. The government needs to redefine the term 'majority' in a referendum to 65% minimum.
attributes.additional_details:
In other countries, such as the US, a major change to the constitution requires two-thirds majority in both the Senate and House of Representatives. The fact that in the UK a result of just over 50% can constitute a major change can and has led to major social divisions within the country whilst also meaning that the will of a significant portion of the population goes unheeded. This makes the country vulnerable to disinformation.

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36306681

attributes.action: A cycle path should be provided by law when roads are  redeveloped or created
attributes.background: housing estates on east way in Preston lancashire have been built and accompanying pavements but no cyclepaths have been created.

attributes.action: Take Pitbulls off the 1991 dangerous dog act.
attributes.background: Any dog can be dangerous, IF IT IS RAISED INCORRECTLY. Pitbulls shouldnâ€™t be banned. Itâ€™s the owners fault for wrongly raising the dogs and action should be taken on owners and not the dogs.

attributes.action: Remove anonymity from MPs accused of misconduct.
attributes.background: MPs have voted to grant themselves anonymity if accused of sexual harassment or expenses misconduct. They will remain anonymous while being investigated â€“ and might not be named even if they are judged guilty.
attributes.additional_details: MPs should not have rights above those of ordinary people. Otherwise, even if they get caught, we may never know.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for pedestrians to cross a road where a crossing is visible.
attributes.background: Too many RTA occur on the roads of England, with a majority of these being due to pedestrians crossing a road where a pedestrian crossing is accessible for them to use. Drivers are punished for stupidity of pedestrians! Itâ€™s illegal in the USA and I feel it should be here where a crossing is visible

attributes.action: Keep Beechen Cliff as a state school as supported by parents and pupils
attributes.background:
The government are querying whether to close Beechen Cliff school in Bath due to a recent Ofsted report. This report was a shock to pupils, teachers and parents and in no way reflects the school.
Please sign this petition to stop the government withdrawing funding and closing the school

attributes.action: Give apt psychological & CBT therapy on NHS to struggling with Asperger Syndrome
attributes.background: People with Asperger Syndrome and other conditions are being denied 1 to 1 appropriate Psychological & Cognitive Behaviour Therapy, even though they may have other conditions e.g. mental health problems. This has a serious impact and prevents them from leading a full balanced life.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS does not currently offer 1 to 1 talking therapies to those with Asperger Syndrome, irrespective of other mental health issues. The Government and NICE to ensure that those in need, requiring such appropriate talking therapies are treated equally to those requiring an operation. The requirement to be deemed as appropriate by the patient and/or a Health Professional/Clinician and/or Social Workers. Those with Asperger Syndrome when needed, be able to access it in a timely manner, as part of an â€˜Overall HOLISTICAL approachâ€™ for as long as it is required to work through direct and associated issues, to a measurable outcome & life balance.

attributes.action: Free menstrual cup given to all 11 year old girls to eliminate period poverty.
attributes.background: Period poverty can be stamped out and our government can do a lot more about it. Free menstral cups and education in how to use them should be given to 11 year old girls when they start secondary school. Half of all school girls needlessly miss at least one full day of school due to their period.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 10 girls aged 14 to 21 canâ€™t afford menstrual products. 
A menstrual cup can last for up to 10 years.
Many women have been forced to use improvised alternatives such as socks and toilet roll.
An average cost of a period in the UK is Â£128 in a year. This would be a saving of Â£1,280 over 10 years.
Young women shouldnâ€™t have their education needlessly compromised.
Use of menstrual cups will reduce non degradable sanitary products being sent to landfill and polluting our environment.

attributes.action: Force UK rail firms to offer Mon-Friday season tickets, to reduce ticket costs.
attributes.background: Weekly/Monthly/Yearly rail season ticket prices are expensive and inflexible, with season ticket pricing including weekend travel. Weekend travel isn't essential for all. We ask that the government force rail firms to offer season tickets which exclude weekends and reducing the prices for them.
attributes.additional_details: The RPI formula means rail ticket prices regularly go up faster than UK wage growth. The year-on-year increase in rail ticket prices is also outstripping many nations in the EU, making rail travel in the UK some of the most expensive in Europe. Unreliability and overcrowding aside, allowing customers to exclude weekend travel could pass on savings, whilst creating fairness and flexibility to customers too.

attributes.action: Give women 2 paid days off a month when needed during their time of the month.
attributes.background: Menstruation is bleeding that occurs when the uterus sheds its lining. Periods usually last from 2-7 days and can be light/heavy. Along with that women experience other symptoms such as back, neck and headaches, nausea, and diarrhea. Most women have to endure this whilst working and it's not right.
attributes.additional_details: Additionally more symptoms are migraines, stomachaches, and vomiting. Up to 20% of women experience extreme cramps at the onset of a period â€“ a condition called dysmenorrhea. These cramps cause immense discomfort and pain, experiencing this at work affects productivity. Many women don't take sick days as it's something they know will come and simply cannot avoid unlike viral or bacterial illnesses almost all people experience. Other countries have adopted this and the UK should rightly follow suit.

attributes.action: Make dog ownership/dog microchip details operate like car ownership.
attributes.background: Many people will have seen the cctv footage of a dog being abandoned on the side of a road in Trentham on 17/12/2018. The dog apparently had two previous owners but microchip details were not available of the current owner.
attributes.additional_details: It is a legal requirement in the UK that dogs of 8 weeks or over are microchipped and the details are updated but this clearly is not working with many dogs being identified with no updated microchip information. The government should make dog ownership similar to car ownership and V5C documentation. Therefore if you sold or transferred ownership to someone else it is the current owners responsibility to check and collect proof of name and address and send details to the microchip company.

attributes.action: Make all foreign lorry/hgv drivers carry insurance cards
attributes.background: To enter the uk, all lorry hgv drivers must carry a insurance card for the hgv they are driving, or a valid card from their employers, incase of a accident or incident, the card would have employment address and insurance details on, drive without one should fine the driver and take the hgv away
attributes.additional_details:
I was involved in a accident and it took the police 45 mins to get his details and his insurance how would the public who are shaken up get that information 
Even the police said good luck 
So a card with insurance address, policy number, name of the employer

attributes.action: Make it compulsary to put food miles on packaging
attributes.background: When I was shopping I saw that English potatoes cost 10p more than egyptian ones. It then occurred to me the distance they had travelled (probably by air) and thought for 10p I can reduce the pollution created by importing goods. If food miles on packaging we can all make informed decisions.

attributes.action: Ban websites supporting and promoting eating disorders, suicide and self harm
attributes.background:
The internet these days are widely accessed by all ages. This allows vulnerable and young people to access harmful content promoting and sharing ideas towards eating disorders, self harm and suicide. 
We would like the government to impose a ban on accessing such sites in the UK
attributes.additional_details: https://www.healthyplace.com/abuse/self-injury/why-pro-self-injury-pro-self-harm-websites-are-dangerous

The rest of the UK did not get to vote on if we wanted Scotland to remain.  Allow all UK citizens, including the Scottish to debate and vote on Scotlandâ€™s continued membership in the UK.

attributes.action: Make school days start at 9:30 and end at 4:30
attributes.background: Research supports that brains function better when your not tired and youâ€™ve had enough sleep, getting to school jus one hour later would make a huge difference to how focused students are at school

attributes.action: Review the use of Palm Oil in products consumed in the UK and itâ€™s taxation.
attributes.background: Palm oil is widely used in everyday products, I believe more can be done to protect areas destroyed for palm oil plantations. I am requesting to UK to set the trend of reviewing the use and availability of palm oil including its taxation.

attributes.action: Lower the age at which men can claim the state pension.
attributes.background: In an age of total equality, surely it is only fair and right that men and women enjoy a similar amount of time in retirement. As life expectancy for men is, on average, 4 years shorter than for women, surely they (men) should be able to claim their state pension 4 years earlier.

attributes.action: Make it an Offence Outside London to Park on Footpaths.
attributes.background: The issues caused by Vehicles parking on Footpaths is General and Not just London, causes Issues with the Disabled Scooters, the Blind, Pushchairs and the Elderly, Vehicles on Footpaths also Cause Damage to the Footpaths costing the Councils Money and the Tax payer
attributes.additional_details:
Footpaths are as in the Name for People on Foot Only for Safety Issues and Children not having to go out into the Road to get by some who do Not care as long as they do not have to walk far.

Parking on footpaths should be illegal outside London as well as inside. Should have never happened that London appears to be Separate from all other Cities and Towns.

attributes.action: Lower the tax for fuel so itâ€™s more affordable
attributes.background: The fuel prices in the uk are reaching an all time high, other countryâ€™s pay way less on fuel! This needs to be actioned now !

attributes.action: Make the legal drinking age for citizens of the UK 16
attributes.background: Youths across the UK already drink without a responsible adult present.

attributes.action: All staff in semh schools to be MHFA trained and a minimum of 7 inset days.
attributes.background: SEMH schools have students with varying needs that are written into an EHCP. It's only right that adequate mandatory training is available to all staff to help these students especially with the varying mental health needs. Funding and timing is a major factor, therefore more inset days are needed.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 4 of us are diagnosed with a MH illness at some point. 50% off these diagnosed needs are displayed at the age of 14. Semh schools deal with a lot of these students that display these needs alongside other needs. To help these students and to give them the best they deserve, it should be mandatory that EVERY member of staff is MHFA trained to recognise and deal with students that are in crisis. These members of staff are the early help for most of these students.

attributes.action: Make all new school buses zero-emission vehicles from 2020.
attributes.background: Over a million children in the UK use school transport provided by transit buses, contracted coaches, minibuses and taxis each day. Weâ€™re asking the government to ensure the vehicles carrying our children to school donâ€™t add to the already harmful levels of air pollution.
attributes.additional_details:
Air quality in the UK has been described as a public health emergency contributing to 40,000 premature deaths per year and it's small children who are affected the most. Electric school bus motors
produce zero emissions. This means cleaner, healthier air while
kids wait to board the bus & inside the cabin.

attributes.action: Reduce tax on smoking tobbaco
attributes.background: Make it cheaper. Itâ€™s a choice people have.

attributes.action: Zero VAT on low sugar snacks for kids/adults <5g/100g.
attributes.background:
The UK is full of high sugar snacks and is suffering an Obesity epidemic- why are VAT Free Junk foods are allowed?
High sugar treats must be VAT rated. VAT should be zero rated for healthy snacks for children/adults  eg. roasted nuts, raisins, frozen yoghurt, protein bars and diabetic chocolate.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 5 kids are obese by the time they leave primary school! This leads to more issues, e.g. low self-esteem, health/welfare issues.
1 in 13 deaths relate to obesity
Who Is Obese in the UK?
66% Adults
25% 2-10 year olds
33% 11-15 year olds

The NHS in England spent Â£6.1 billion on overweight and obesity-related ill-health in 2014 to 15. We spend more each year on the treatment of obesity and diabetes than we do on the police, fire service and judicial system combined.The overall cost of obesity to the wider society is estimated at Â£27 billion.
https://publichealthmatters.blog.gov.uk/2017/03/31/health-matters-obesity-and-the-food-environment/

The VAT free status on any high sugary foods/ snacks/ treats has to stop. 
VAT on healthy foods has to be made VAT free.

attributes.action: Pass a law restricting the promotion and display of alcoholic beverages in shops
attributes.background: Shops must be more responsible by not displaying alcoholic beverages at the front of the shop where people are forced to pass by it. They should limit the use of promotional marketing so as not to encourage people to purchase alcohol, particularly vulnerable & disadvantaged people in society.
attributes.additional_details: Thousands die from alcohol-related diseases every year. The cost and burden on the NHS is vast. It is the second biggest preventable killer behind smoking. The negative impact of alcohol is worse than smoking because it takes away a persons dignity, self esteem and ruins the lives of family and loved ones. Banning advertising of cigarettes has reduced smoking-related illness. Alcohol should be no different. For example, Tesco should not be having a 'Drinks Festival' a campaign encouraging people to drink.

attributes.action: Ban perpetrators of domestic violence representing themselves in family court
attributes.background: In domestic abuse cases in family court, the abuser continues to abuse and control their victim by choosing to self-represent. This is a way for them to obtain personal information i.e. medical records about their victim.
attributes.additional_details: Womenâ€™s aid are aware of the perpetrators motives and are in agreement the way family courts are run needs to change. Women are losing their children due to domestic abuse even when they leave the abuser the abuse still continues. The abuser uses the family court to obtain personal information on their victim by self-representing. This needs to be stopped. The criminal courts have put this in place so why not the civil courts? Women are being put through massive amount of stress during these proceedings when the protection can be put there! Cafcass also need in-depth training on domestic abuse.

attributes.action: Teach schools about emotional & physical wellbeing, mental health & illnesses
attributes.background: I think it is very important that from a young age our children should be taught more about the effects of mental illness and show them a positive outlook on life through physical and emotional wellbeing. This can be yoga, meditation, holistic studies etc. Our children are our future!
attributes.additional_details: As a sufferer of mental illness from a very early age due to family problems & bullying, I think its vital that children should have the opportunity to be more educated on the affects of mental illness as it has such an impact on them in the future. Introducing wellbeing & complementary therapy classes to the curriculum I believe would help a lot of children understand how mental illness works and how to tackle it positively. I strongly believe that emotional and physical wellbeing is crucial.

attributes.action: Hold a Referendum on the Membership of NATO.
attributes.background: The British public should have an opportunity to determine whether the country should play a role in the future in the The North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO).
attributes.additional_details: NATO was founded in 1949 by the United States as a military alliance between western nations to oppose the Soviet Union and serve a purpose in defending the west against the eastern block. However, today NATO is now a cold war relic. Britain should take control over its military affairs and its foreign policy to prevent the country from getting involved in wars.  We should follow our own operations rather than following NATO.

attributes.action: Introduce a goverment helpline for mental health
attributes.background: 1 in 4 people will expirence a mental health issue each year. Why donâ€™t we have a goverment helpline, like 999, for people expirencing a problem or crisis? We need to do more to help people.

attributes.background:
Royal navy wrecks from ww2 are at risk of being blown up for scrap metal in south East Asia.
Dutch wrecks have simply disappeared.
Our dead saliors have a claim on us to protect them in death as they protected us in life.

No WW2 Royal Navy battleships are preserved. We risk losing them forever
attributes.additional_details:
Everything I have said in the background information is able to be checked in Google and I have come across information in the media, see link below
https://www.theguardian.com/world/ng-interactive/2017/nov/03/worlds-biggest-grave-robbery-asias-disappearing-ww2-shipwrecks

attributes.action: Raise awareness towards borderline personality disorder (BPD).
attributes.background: Borderline Personality Disorder(BPD) affects people of all ages and it is brought on by previous traumatic experiences that cause/caused instability within someone's life. Those who suffer with BPD don't usually realise until late into adolescents, around 1 in 10 diagnosed end up committing suicide
attributes.additional_details: More awareness and understanding needs to be made available nationally to ensure that this number decreases. This is one of many mental health issues within the UK that is unheard of and for the most part, unknown. Often overlooked as Depression or Anxiety, BPD needs both awareness and more accurate diagnoses. We hope with this petition this can become a reality.

attributes.action: Amend Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984 and Road Traffic Offenders Act 1988
attributes.background: I am a scooter rider who has ridden to work, from Kew to Central London, each day for many many years...with no fines! I have recently received 4 speeding tickets in one week for marginally exceeding the speed limit on the A40.
attributes.additional_details: I strongly believe the punishments in such cases (SP 30) do not fit the crime. My suggestion is that the law is changed so that penalty points are allocated depending on the amount of the excess speed reached...for instance 1 penalty point for 5 mile per hour excess..2 penalty points for 10 miles per hour and so on.

attributes.action: Freeze Rent / Mortgage payments for poorly people who are not be fit to work.
attributes.background: People are getting evicted from their homes due to not being able to afford their rent / mortgage payments when they have a serious illness such as cancer. Sometimes benefits won't cover the mortgage / rent payments.
attributes.additional_details: Help sick people to stay in their homes by covering their rent payments in full through benefits or if they have a mortgage then freeze their payments until they are fit to return to work.

attributes.action:
Change minimum wage to at least Â£10 an hour. 

Stop the struggle!
attributes.background:
Life is a struggle already, without factoring in the low minimum wage the uk are made to endure. Living cost keeps going up, but we are all stuck trying to climb back on top.

We need this to change our country and to better it, and create a future that is bright.
attributes.additional_details:
Life within our current economic climate is a struggle, and stability is essentially unachievable. Living costs are increasing but minimum wage is staying the same. 

Therefore, we need to galvanise our country  into making a change and to ensure our future generations are prosperous

attributes.action: Put pressure on Bangladeshi government to improve road safety
